intro: Crusea calocephala, commonly known as the velvetleaf. It is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety texture. It produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Crusea calocephala is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
